title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) – In the grand, aging expanse of The Summit, history wore the familiar red and white of the Houston Rockets. On a night that transcended a mere regular-season game, Hakeem Olajuwon didn't just play basketball; he authored a masterpiece, pouring in a career-high 49 points to will the Houston Rockets to a thrilling 123-119 victory over the Los Angeles Clippers.

From the opening tip, it was clear Olajuwon was operating on a different plane. The Clippers had no answer for "The Dream's" dizzying array of post moves, his feathery-soft touch from the perimeter, and his relentless presence on the glass. He was a force of nature, scoring at will and pulling down 19 rebounds to complete a dominant double-double that left defenders grasping at air.

While Olajuwon’s singular brilliance defined the evening, the Clippers fought valiantly. Loy Vaught’s 25 points and 18 rebounds provided a sturdy interior counterpoint, and Malik Sealy chipped in 22 points to keep Los Angeles within striking distance throughout the tense, back-and-forth affair.

Yet, every time the Clippers threatened to seize momentum, Olajuwon had an answer. A sweeping hook shot in the lane. A turnaround jumper from the baseline. A powerful put-back dunk. He was the immovable object and the unstoppable force, all in one breathtaking performance.

In the final, chaotic minutes, with the outcome still hanging in the balance, it was Olajuwon who secured the crucial rebounds and iced the game from the free-throw line, finishing a perfect 9-for-9 from the stripe. When the final horn sounded, the scoreboard told the story of a narrow Rockets win. But the stat sheet, and the awe-struck faces in the crowd, told the story of one man’s legendary night—49 points that cemented Hakeem Olajuwon’s place among the game’s all-time greats.
